note.para: Настоятельно рекомендуем выполнить сначала тестовое обновление в отдельной тестовой среде.

varlistentry.term: Updating from an earlier version of OTRS 7

listitem.para: You can update directly from any previous to the latest available patch level release.
You can update from any OTRS 6 patch level to the latest available OTRS 7 patch level release.

warning.para: You cannot update from OTRS 5 or earlier directly to OTRS 7. Full updates to all available minor versions have to be made sequentially instead. For example, if you come from OTRS 4.0, you first have to perform a full update to OTRS 5, then to 6 and finally to OTRS 7.

section.title: Step 1: Stop all relevant services and the OTRS Daemon
section.para: Please make sure there are no more running services or cron jobs that try to access OTRS. This will depend on your service configuration, here is an example:

para.screen: root> /etc/init.d/cron stop root> /etc/init.d/postfix stop root> /etc/init.d/apache stop

section.para: Stop OTRS cron jobs and the daemon (in this order):

para.screen: otrs> cd /opt/otrs/ otrs> bin/Cron.sh stop otrs> bin/otrs.Daemon.pl stop

section.para: If you perform a patch level update of OTRS 7, you need to also stop the built-in OTRS web server: otrs> cd /opt/otrs/ otrs> bin/otrs.WebServer.pl --stop

listitem.para: Kernel/WebApp.conf (only in case of a patch level update of OTRS 7, and only if the file was modified)

warning.para: Don't proceed without a complete backup of your system.

section.title: Step 3: Install the new release

note.para: With OTRS 7 RPMs are no longer provided. RPM based installations need to switch by uninstalling the RPM (this will not drop your database) and using the source archives instead.

section.screen: root> cd /opt root> mv otrs otrs-old root> tar -xzf otrs-x.x.x.tar.gz root> mv otrs-x.x.x otrs

listitem.para: Kernel/WebApp.conf (only in case of a patch level update of OTRS 7, and only if the file was modified)

section.title: Восстановить данные статьи
section.para: If you configured OTRS to store article data in the file system you have to restore the article folder to /opt/otrs/var/ or the folder specified in the System Configuration.

section.title: Restore already installed default statistics
section.para: If you have additional packages with default statistics you have to restore the stats xml files with the suffix *.installed to /opt/otrs/var/stats.

section.title: Установка прав доступа к файлам.
section.para: Please execute the following command as root user to set the file and directory permissions for OTRS. It will try to detect the correct user and group settings needed for your setup.

section.title: Install Required Programs and Perl Modules
section.para: Please refer to the section in the installation guide that explains how to verify external dependencies such as Perl modules and Node.js.
In addition to that, OTRS 7 also requires an active cluster of Elasticsearch 6.0 or higher. Please refer to the Setup Elasticsearch Cluster section in the installation guide.

section.title: Step 4: Run the migration script

note.para: If you have any custom Perl or XML configuration files in Kernel/Config/Files, these need to be converted to the new formats supported by OTRS 7 before running the migration script.

section.para: The migration script will perform many checks on your system and give you advice on how to install missing Perl modules etc., if that is required. If all checks succeeded, the necessary migration steps will be performed. Please also run this script in case of patch level updates.
Run the migration script (as user otrs, NOT as root):

warning.para: Do not continue the upgrading process if this script did not work properly for you. Otherwise malfunction or data loss may occur.

section.title: Step 5: Update installed packages

note.para: Packages for OTRS 6 are not compatible with OTRS 7 and have to be updated.

section.para: You can use the command below to update all installed packages. This works for all packages that are available from online repositories. You can update other packages later via the package manager (this requires a running OTRS Daemon).

section.title: Step 6: Restart your services
section.para: OTRS 7 comes with an own built-in web server that is used behind apache as a reverse proxy (or any other reverse proxy server). For major updates from OTRS 6, the apache configuration must be updated with the new version in /opt/otrs/scripts/apache2-httpd.include.conf, if it was copied and not just linked. Please also note that while mod_perl is no longer needed, other Apache modules are required now: proxy_module, proxy_http_module and proxy_wstunnel_module.
After that, the services can be restarted. This will depend on your service configuration, here is an example:

para.screen: root> /etc/init.d/apache start root> /etc/init.d/postfix start root> /etc/init.d/cron start

note.para: The OTRS Daemon is required for correct operation of OTRS such as sending emails. Please activate it as described in the next step.

section.title: Step 7: Start the OTRS Daemon, web server and cron job
section.para: The OTRS Daemon is responsible for handling any asynchronous and recurring tasks in OTRS. The daemon and its keepalive cron job must be started as the otrs user. The built-in OTRS web server process handles the web requests handed over from Apache.

para.screen: otrs> cd /opt/otrs/ otrs> bin/otrs.Daemon.pl start otrs> bin/Cron.sh start otrs> bin/otrs.WebServer.pl

section.para: Now you can log into your system.
